snippet: Speaking at a summit meeting, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton did not address legislation in Congress that has so far blocked the move to lift cold-war-era trade sanctions.
abstract: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton pledges that the United States will soon lift cold-war-era trade sanctions on Russia, but she does not address human rights legislation in Congress that has so far stalled passage, infuriated Russia and become an unexpected issue in the American presidential race.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

lead_paragraph: Speaking at a summit meeting, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton did not address legislation in Congress that has so far blocked the move to lift cold-war-era trade sanctions.

headline.seo: Clinton Tells Russia Sanctions Will End, but Congress May Disagree
headline.main: Clinton Tells Russia That Sanctions Will Soon End
headline.print_headline: Clinton Tells Russia That Sanctions Will Soon End

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
